name: Feedly v.19 minimal dark (not maintained)
description: Feed this style to Feedly for comfortable reading! Also see Feedly v20 minimal. Try using the userscript "Feedly Colorful Listview and Tweaks" from Kenijo.

user.name: sharethewisdom
user.about:
I like keyboard navigation, which also makes browsing more pleasant. I find it strange that web developers use so many unnecessary margins and sub menu's. 
That's why I currently (October 2013) use Firefox 23.0.1 with vimperator 3.7.1 and some interesting plugins from here https://github.com/vimpr/vimperator-plugins.

additional_info:
I personally favour keeping interfaces clean and unused vertical spaces to a minimum. I recommend using the site's keyboard shortcuts (type "?") for navigation and turning off most of the social networking icons. "Title Only" presentation view should be adjusted to Firefox's default mousewheel scroll factor mousewheel.default.delta_multiplier_x=100. To make the successively selected items 'static' on the page when scrolling, they need to retain the exact position. Make sure that you change the smooth scroll setting general.smoothScroll to false. I use this in conjunction with the userscript "Feedly Colorful Listview and Tweaks" from Kenijo. Also try using the userscript FeedlyFlickEntry by Kocari to use a delimited list of keywords (regex) for automatically marking items as read in the "All" list! (sorry I don't keep a good record on changes)
